topics.body:
_You would be mortified if I would put on screen what I've seen
Horrified holy Bibles, rivals, vital organs
Little bitty baby bodies, bridal gowns coffins
Morphine, gang bang, gangrene, slauson, swap meet_

topics.body:
Here's something interesting that is relevant to the news:
Do you think the pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong will spread to the mainland?

Personally I hope so and I think it'll eventually happen; the protesters are massively being polite and such cause they know the most effective form of protest is ones that are peaceful.  If you have peaceful protests and the police fight back that's going to make shit hit the fan and the protesters are going to have a lot of support.  The question is how long until the protests spread?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542c477a6368727024d10000#post_542c477a6368727024d10000
Well it really couldn't make things any worse.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/542c47ae6368727024df0000#post_542c47ae6368727024df0000
I missed a piece of information; the protests have already slightly spread into Macau and Taiwan so yeah the protests are spreading slowly.  If I had to take a guess this will probably have a extremely slow domino effect like on the order of five to ten years until support for democracy in china is to the point where china has to give in.
